intro: Pleuranthodium macropycnanthum, commonly known as the large-fruited pleuranthodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is found in regions with a Mediterranean climate. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
